body: I'm also hitting this issue, and it also seems to not be working in regular (non-async) routes...

@fafhrd91 I'd like to attempt to fix this in a PR. Can you point me at where this logic is implemented? Is it in `actix-http`? If so, how can I set up a working (local) checkout with which I can test this?
Error and RespinseError are defined in actix-http. But I donâ€™t think this is the bug, it is a problem of docs and probably not very well designed api.
@fafhrd91 ðŸ‘ I will try to add it in. Thanks!
@fafhrd91 any objections that I make it an `error!`? I think a server returning 500 merits an error log in such cases...
error! For 500 is ok, but some errors could be converted to different status codes and I am not sure it is good idea to use error for them

I opened a PR to restore the original behavior (logging as `debug!`). Will try to create an additional one to log internal server errors as `error!`, as this is critical for production deployments (actix_web tends to be set on a log level higher than debug for such cases)
My PR now contains code to log internal server errors as well. Feedback is most welcome!

@cypressf This issue is very old and not relevant to your version on Actix Web. Please open a [new discussion](https://github.com/actix/actix-web/discussions) with your question. Someone will be happy to answer there.
